page.title: 03SOUTH CERNEY ARMY CAMP(CONT)
page.content:
The specialist role of the Regiment is in the transportation of troops and their equipment to various parts of the world. Men can be prepared for flying out from R.A.F Brize Norton in Oxfordshire, personal equipment can be checked if necessary, over night accomodation and food can be provided. The transportation of heavy equipment such as Land Rovers, Armoured Cars, and large weapons, is provided by R.A.F.Lyneham in Wiltshire , but the logistical organisation and preparation is done at South Cerney. This very specialised work has been used this year for famine relief in Ethiopia.
(Continued on page 4)
